track_notes: Straight-forward transfer from GW/NW-033. Follow the fence line to the pile of stones and right, down the hill. Keep straight ahead following track uphill through Esgair Forest. Follow ridge line beside fence. Keep to 430-m contour from SH702045, south of small summit. Rise to Tarrenhendre.

Done in descent. Might be easier to follow in ascent.
Through the quarry. A diversion to SH693053 will take you to a bilingual audio post about the quarry. I wonder if there are others here? Track out of quarry easy to follow onto forest paths but then it goes a bit wrong. The part leaving the forest is the worst, with waist-deep shrubs to get to the stile at the bwlch. Maybe you can improve on my track here. Over the fence turn right and make the final ascent.

Route 2 is probably easier...
Park at car park next to B4405 (£2 for 4 hours in 2022).  Follow path alongside river and waterfalls for approx 1 mile until you reach bridge 4? and a no entry sign.
Follow steep path up the bank and rocks to left of the sign and step over the wall/fence as soon as possible.  TAKE CARE - the path seems to have collapsed (hence the sign) and if you go too far there is a hole and a drop into the river below!
Follow path on north side of wall into meadow and double back up steep slope to reach the stone track (public footpath).  Follow track to ford (route 2 diverges here) and paddle or cross river at some point upstream then continue on track to sheepfolds.
The path on the OS Explorer map is on the south side of the fence behind the sheepfold, however the path on the north side is less boggy.  Follow fence upwards,  some easy scrambling up the rocks required unless you find a way around them then follow track on south side of fence to the summit.

This is G0HIOs route described on the summit page in the database.

Park at car park next to B4405 (£2 for 4 hours in 2022).
Follow path alongside river for approx 1 mile until you reach bridge 4? and a no entry sign.

Follow steep path up the bank and rocks to left of the sign and step over the wall/fence as soon as possible.  TAKE CARE - the path seems to have collapsed (hence the sign) and if you go too far there is a hole and a drop into the river below!
Follow path on north side of wall into meadow and double back up steep slope to reach the stone track (public footpath).
Follow track to ford but turn left up track just beforehand and follow track for approx 1 mile up to fence.
Head south following fence up steep grassy climb to the summit.
